00019 /*! \file
00020  *
00021  * \brief Device state management
00022  *
00023  *
00024  * \author Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com> 
00025  *
00026  * \arg \ref AstExtState
00027  */
00028 /*! \page AstExtState Extension and device states in Asterisk
00029  *
00030  * Asterisk has an internal system that reports states
00031  * for an extension. By using the dialplan priority -1,
00032  * also called a \b hint, a connection can be made from an
00033  * extension to one or many devices. The state of the extension
00034  * now depends on the combined state of the devices.
00035  *
00036  * The device state is basically based on the current calls.
00037  * If the devicestate engine can find a call from or to the
00038  * device, it's in use.
00039  * 
00040  * Some channel drivers implement a callback function for 
00041  * a better level of reporting device states. The SIP channel
00042  * has a complicated system for this, which is improved 
00043  * by adding call limits to the configuration.
00044  * 
00045  * Functions that want to check the status of an extension
00046  * register themself as a \b watcher.
00047  * Watchers in this system can subscribe either to all extensions
00048  * or just a specific extensions.
00049  *
00050  * For non-device related states, there's an API called
00051  * devicestate providers. This is an extendible system for
00052  * delivering state information from outside sources or
00053  * functions within Asterisk. Currently we have providers
00054  * for app_meetme.c - the conference bridge - and call
00055  * parking (metermaids).
00056  *
00057  * There are manly three subscribers to extension states 
00058  * within Asterisk:
00059  * - AMI, the manager interface
00060  * - app_queue.c - the Queue dialplan application
00061  * - SIP subscriptions, a.k.a. "blinking lamps" or 
00062  *   "buddy lists"
00063  *
00064  * The CLI command "show hints" show last known state
00065  *
00066  * \note None of these handle user states, like an IM presence
00067  * system. res_jabber.c can subscribe and watch such states
00068  * in jabber/xmpp based systems.
00069  *
00070  * \section AstDevStateArch Architecture for devicestates
00071  *
00072  * When a channel driver or asterisk app changes state for 
00073  * a watched object, it alerts the core. The core queues
00074  * a change. When the change is processed, there's a query
00075  * sent to the channel driver/provider if there's a function
00076  * to handle that, otherwise a channel walk is issued to find
00077  * a channel that involves the object.
00078  * 
00079  * The changes are queued and processed by a separate thread.
00080  * This thread calls the watchers subscribing to status 
00081  * changes for the object. For manager, this results 
00082  * in events. For SIP, NOTIFY requests.
00083  *
00084  * - Device states
00085  *    \arg \ref devicestate.c 
00086  *    \arg \ref devicestate.h 
00087  *
00088  * \section AstExtStateArch Architecture for extension states
00089  * 
00090  * Hints are connected to extension. If an extension changes state
00091  * it checks the hint devices. If there is a hint, the callbacks into
00092  * device states are checked. The aggregated state is set for the hint
00093  * and reported back.
00094  *
00095  * - Extension states
00096  *    \arg \ref enum ast_extension_states
00097  *    \arg \ref pbx.c 
00098  *    \arg \ref pbx.h 
00099  * - Structures
00100  *    - \ref struct ast_state_cb  Callbacks for watchers
00101  *    - Callback ast_state_cb_type
00102  *    - \ref struct ast_hint
00103  *    - Functions
00104  *    - ast_extension_state_add()
00105  *    - ast_extension_state_del()
00106  *    - ast_get_hint()
00107  * 
00108  */
00109

00130 /*! \brief Device state strings for printing */
00131 static const char *devstatestring[] = {
00132    /* 0 AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN */ "Unknown",  /*!< Valid, but unknown state */
00133    /* 1 AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE */  "Not in use",  /*!< Not used */
00134    /* 2 AST_DEVICE IN USE */  "In use",   /*!< In use */
00135    /* 3 AST_DEVICE_BUSY */    "Busy",     /*!< Busy */
00136    /* 4 AST_DEVICE_INVALID */ "Invalid",  /*!< Invalid - not known to Asterisk */
00137    /* 5 AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE */   "Unavailable", /*!< Unavailable (not registred) */
00138    /* 6 AST_DEVICE_RINGING */ "Ringing",  /*!< Ring, ring, ring */
00139    /* 7 AST_DEVICE_RINGINUSE */  "Ring+Inuse",  /*!< Ring and in use */
00140    /* 8 AST_DEVICE_ONHOLD */  "On Hold"   /*!< On Hold */
00141 };

00143 /*! \brief  A device state provider (not a channel) */
00144 struct devstate_prov {
00145    char label[40];
00146    ast_devstate_prov_cb_type callback;
00147    AST_RWLIST_ENTRY(devstate_prov) list;
00148 };
00149 
00150 /*! \brief A list of providers */
00151 static AST_RWLIST_HEAD_STATIC(devstate_provs, devstate_prov);

00153 /*! \brief  A device state watcher (callback) */
00154 struct devstate_cb {
00155    void *data;
00156    ast_devstate_cb_type callback;   /*!< Where to report when state changes */
00157    AST_RWLIST_ENTRY(devstate_cb) list;
00158 };

00160 /*! \brief A device state watcher list */
00161 static AST_RWLIST_HEAD_STATIC(devstate_cbs, devstate_cb);

00163 struct state_change {
00164    AST_LIST_ENTRY(state_change) list;
00165    char device[1];
00166 };
00167 
00168 /*! \brief The state change queue. State changes are queued
00169    for processing by a separate thread */
00170 static AST_LIST_HEAD_STATIC(state_changes, state_change);

00172 /*! \brief The device state change notification thread */
00173 static pthread_t change_thread = AST_PTHREADT_NULL;
00174 
00175 /*! \brief Flag for the queue */
00176 static ast_cond_t change_pending;

00181 /*! \brief Find devicestate as text message for output */
00182 const char *devstate2str(enum ast_device_state devstate) 
00183 {
00184    return devstatestring[devstate];
00185 }
00186 
00187 const char *ast_devstate_str(enum ast_device_state state)
00188 {
00189    const char *res = "UNKNOWN";
00190 
00191    switch (state) {
00192    case AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN:
00193       break;
00194    case AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE:
00195       res = "NOT_INUSE";
00196       break;
00197    case AST_DEVICE_INUSE:
00198       res = "INUSE";
00199       break;
00200    case AST_DEVICE_BUSY:
00201       res = "BUSY";
00202       break;
00203    case AST_DEVICE_INVALID:
00204       res = "INVALID";
00205       break;
00206    case AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE:
00207       res = "UNAVAILABLE";
00208       break;
00209    case AST_DEVICE_RINGING:
00210       res = "RINGING";
00211       break;
00212    case AST_DEVICE_RINGINUSE:
00213       res = "RINGINUSE";
00214       break;
00215    case AST_DEVICE_ONHOLD:
00216       res = "ONHOLD";
00217       break;
00218    }
00219 
00220    return res;
00221 }
00222 
00223 enum ast_device_state ast_devstate_val(const char *val)
00224 {
00225    if (!strcasecmp(val, "NOT_INUSE"))
00226       return AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE;
00227    else if (!strcasecmp(val, "INUSE"))
00228       return AST_DEVICE_INUSE;
00229    else if (!strcasecmp(val, "BUSY"))
00230       return AST_DEVICE_BUSY;
00231    else if (!strcasecmp(val, "INVALID"))
00232       return AST_DEVICE_INVALID;
00233    else if (!strcasecmp(val, "UNAVAILABLE"))
00234       return AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE;
00235    else if (!strcasecmp(val, "RINGING"))
00236       return AST_DEVICE_RINGING;
00237    else if (!strcasecmp(val, "RINGINUSE"))
00238       return AST_DEVICE_RINGINUSE;
00239    else if (!strcasecmp(val, "ONHOLD"))
00240       return AST_DEVICE_ONHOLD;
00241 
00242    return AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN;
00243 }
00244 
00245 /*! \brief Find out if device is active in a call or not 
00246    \note find channels with the device's name in it
00247    This function is only used for channels that does not implement 
00248    devicestate natively
00249 */
00250 enum ast_device_state ast_parse_device_state(const char *device)
00251 {
00252    struct ast_channel *chan;
00253    char match[AST_CHANNEL_NAME];
00254    enum ast_device_state res;
00255 
00256    ast_copy_string(match, device, sizeof(match)-1);
00257    strcat(match, "-");
00258    chan = ast_get_channel_by_name_prefix_locked(match, strlen(match));
00259 
00260    if (!chan)
00261       return AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN;
00262 
00263    if (chan->_state == AST_STATE_RINGING)
00264       res = AST_DEVICE_RINGING;
00265    else
00266       res = AST_DEVICE_INUSE;
00267    
00268    ast_channel_unlock(chan);
00269 
00270    return res;
00271 }
00272 
00273 /*! \brief Check device state through channel specific function or generic function */
00274 enum ast_device_state ast_device_state(const char *device)
00275 {
00276    char *buf;
00277    char *number;
00278    const struct ast_channel_tech *chan_tech;
00279    enum ast_device_state res = AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN;
00280    /*! \brief Channel driver that provides device state */
00281    char *tech;
00282    /*! \brief Another provider of device state */
00283    char *provider = NULL;
00284    
00285    buf = ast_strdupa(device);
00286    tech = strsep(&buf, "/");
00287    if (!(number = buf)) {
00288       if (!(provider = strsep(&tech, ":")))
00289          return AST_DEVICE_INVALID;
00290       /* We have a provider */
00291       number = tech;
00292       tech = NULL;
00293    }
00294 
00295    if (provider)  {
00296       if (option_debug > 2)
00297          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Checking if I can find provider for \"%s\" - number: %s\n", provider, number);
00298       return getproviderstate(provider, number);
00299    }
00300 
00301    if (option_debug > 3)
00302       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "No provider found, checking channel drivers for %s - %s\n", tech, number);
00303 
00304    if (!(chan_tech = ast_get_channel_tech(tech)))
00305       return AST_DEVICE_INVALID;
00306 
00307    if (!(chan_tech->devicestate)) /* Does the channel driver support device state notification? */
00308       return ast_parse_device_state(device); /* No, try the generic function */
00309 
00310    res = chan_tech->devicestate(number);
00311 
00312    if (res != AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN)
00313       return res;
00314 
00315    res = ast_parse_device_state(device);
00316 
00317    if (res == AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN)
00318       return AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE;
00319 
00320    return res;
00321 }
00322 
00323 /*! \brief Add device state provider */
00324 int ast_devstate_prov_add(const char *label, ast_devstate_prov_cb_type callback)
00325 {
00326    struct devstate_prov *devprov;
00327 
00328    if (!callback || !(devprov = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*devprov))))
00329       return -1;
00330 
00331    devprov->callback = callback;
00332    ast_copy_string(devprov->label, label, sizeof(devprov->label));
00333 
00334    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&devstate_provs);
00335    AST_RWLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&devstate_provs, devprov, list);
00336    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&devstate_provs);
00337 
00338    return 0;
00339 }
00340 
00341 /*! \brief Remove device state provider */
00342 int ast_devstate_prov_del(const char *label)
00343 {
00344    struct devstate_prov *devcb;
00345    int res = -1;
00346 
00347    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&devstate_provs);
00348    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&devstate_provs, devcb, list) {
00349       if (!strcasecmp(devcb->label, label)) {
00350          AST_RWLIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&devstate_provs, list);
00351          free(devcb);
00352          res = 0;
00353          break;
00354       }
00355    }
00356    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00357    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&devstate_provs);
00358 
00359    return res;
00360 }
00361 
00362 /*! \brief Get provider device state */
00363 static int getproviderstate(const char *provider, const char *address)
00364 {
00365    struct devstate_prov *devprov;
00366    int res = AST_DEVICE_INVALID;
00367 
00368 
00369    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&devstate_provs);
00370    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&devstate_provs, devprov, list) {
00371       if (option_debug > 4)
00372          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Checking provider %s with %s\n", devprov->label, provider);
00373 
00374       if (!strcasecmp(devprov->label, provider)) {
00375          res = devprov->callback(address);
00376          break;
00377       }
00378    }
00379    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&devstate_provs);
00380    return res;
00381 }
00382 
00383 /*! \brief Add device state watcher */
00384 int ast_devstate_add(ast_devstate_cb_type callback, void *data)
00385 {
00386    struct devstate_cb *devcb;
00387 
00388    if (!callback || !(devcb = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*devcb))))
00389       return -1;
00390 
00391    devcb->data = data;
00392    devcb->callback = callback;
00393 
00394    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&devstate_cbs);
00395    AST_RWLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&devstate_cbs, devcb, list);
00396    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&devstate_cbs);
00397 
00398    return 0;
00399 }
00400 
00401 /*! \brief Remove device state watcher */
00402 void ast_devstate_del(ast_devstate_cb_type callback, void *data)
00403 {
00404    struct devstate_cb *devcb;
00405 
00406    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&devstate_cbs);
00407    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&devstate_cbs, devcb, list) {
00408       if ((devcb->callback == callback) && (devcb->data == data)) {
00409          AST_RWLIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&devstate_cbs, list);
00410          free(devcb);
00411          break;
00412       }
00413    }
00414    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END;
00415    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&devstate_cbs);
00416 }
00417 
00418 /*! \brief Notify callback watchers of change, and notify PBX core for hint updates
00419    Normally executed within a separate thread
00420 */
00421 static void do_state_change(const char *device)
00422 {
00423    int state;
00424    struct devstate_cb *devcb;
00425 
00426    state = ast_device_state(device);
00427    if (option_debug > 2)
00428       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Changing state for %s - state %d (%s)\n", device, state, devstate2str(state));
00429 
00430    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&devstate_cbs);
00431    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&devstate_cbs, devcb, list)
00432       devcb->callback(device, state, devcb->data);
00433    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&devstate_cbs);
00434 
00435    ast_hint_state_changed(device);
00436 }
00437 
00438 static int __ast_device_state_changed_literal(char *buf)
00439 {
00440    char *device;
00441    struct state_change *change;
00442 
00443    if (option_debug > 2)
00444       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Notification of state change to be queued on device/channel %s\n", buf);
00445 
00446    device = buf;
00447 
00448    if (!strncasecmp(device, "Zap", 3)) {
00449       char *tmp = strrchr(device, '-');
00450       if (tmp)
00451          *tmp = '\0';
00452    }
00453 
00454    if (change_thread == AST_PTHREADT_NULL || !(change = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*change) + strlen(device)))) {
00455       /* we could not allocate a change struct, or */
00456       /* there is no background thread, so process the change now */
00457       do_state_change(device);
00458    } else {
00459       /* queue the change */
00460       strcpy(change->device, device);
00461       AST_LIST_LOCK(&state_changes);
00462       AST_LIST_INSERT_TAIL(&state_changes, change, list);
00463       ast_cond_signal(&change_pending);
00464       AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&state_changes);
00465    }
00466 
00467    return 1;
00468 }
00469 
00470 int ast_device_state_changed_literal(const char *dev)
00471 {
00472    char *buf;
00473    buf = ast_strdupa(dev);
00474    return __ast_device_state_changed_literal(buf);
00475 }
00476 
00477 /*! \brief Accept change notification, add it to change queue */
00478 int ast_device_state_changed(const char *fmt, ...) 
00479 {
00480    char buf[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
00481    va_list ap;
00482 
00483    va_start(ap, fmt);
00484    vsnprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), fmt, ap);
00485    va_end(ap);
00486    return __ast_device_state_changed_literal(buf);
00487 }
00488 
00489 /*! \brief Go through the dev state change queue and update changes in the dev state thread */
00490 static void *do_devstate_changes(void *data)
00491 {
00492    struct state_change *next, *current;
00493 
00494    for (;;) {
00495       /* This basically pops off any state change entries, resets the list back to NULL, unlocks, and processes each state change */
00496       AST_LIST_LOCK(&state_changes);
00497       if (AST_LIST_EMPTY(&state_changes))
00498          ast_cond_wait(&change_pending, &state_changes.lock);
00499       next = AST_LIST_FIRST(&state_changes);
00500       AST_LIST_HEAD_INIT_NOLOCK(&state_changes);
00501       AST_LIST_UNLOCK(&state_changes);
00502 
00503       /* Process each state change */
00504       while ((current = next)) {
00505          next = AST_LIST_NEXT(current, list);
00506          do_state_change(current->device);
00507          free(current);
00508       }
00509    }
00510 
00511    return NULL;
00512 }
00513 
00514 /*! \brief Initialize the device state engine in separate thread */
00515 int ast_device_state_engine_init(void)
00516 {
00517    ast_cond_init(&change_pending, NULL);
00518    if (ast_pthread_create_background(&change_thread, NULL, do_devstate_changes, NULL) < 0) {
00519       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to start device state change thread.\n");
00520       return -1;
00521    }
00522 
00523    return 0;
00524 }
